fields.description:
Suppose I have copied a list with the following HTML code somewhere (using Ctrl+C): {code:html}
  • list item 1
  • list item 2
{code} Now I paste this list into the following list (using Ctrl+V, the cursor position is indicated by the |) {code}
  • list it|em 3
  • list item 4
{code} The resulting HTML code is: {code:html}
    • list it
    • list item 1
    • list item 2
    • em 3
    • list item 4
    {code} The expected HTML code would be: {code:html}
    • list it
    • list item 1
    • list item 2
    • em 3
    • list item 4
    {code} This is caused by the ConfluencePasteListPlugin TinyMCE plugin. It changes the TinyMCE default behaviour (of creating a nested list on pasting) by merging the two lists. But instead of adding the pasted list items to the existing list, it creates a new list and adds both the existing and the pasted items to it. This causes the style information of the list (such as class names or other attributes) to get lost and creates an unnecessary ghost node in the editor. Tested with Confluence 4.0-m36 in Firefox 5 and in Chromium 12.
fields.summary: Weird merging behaviour when pasting lists

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23015].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of September 21, 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi all,

Thanks for voting on this issue and providing us with your feedback. We've revisited this suggestion, and unfortunately this isn't something we'll be looking at developing within the next 12 months.

From reading your comments, we fully appreciate that this feature is important to many of you. We're interested in understanding further why you want to mention groups on a page as opposed to sharing the page with them. 

There are a couple of workarounds (mentioned by others in this thread) that may be of help to you in the meantime:
 * Create a new 'dummy' user, with the username and email address relating to the group
 ** The user will count towards the license
 * For Cloud users, there's the Bandage add-on: [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/bandage-conf/cloud/overview]

Best wishes,
 Jenny Millman | Senior Product Manager - Confluence Server
{panel}
fields.summary: Extend 'Mentions' to work with groups as well

fields.description:
The problem is that for big user bases, the user already spent minutes waiting for the sync to finish. If the page is refreshed user would have to wait for a full synch to complete again (because the "Next" button becomes disabled again).

Video recording: http://screencast.com/t/mfVx0x8KzPKv
fields.summary: After reaching the syncrhonization complete stage, if user refreshes the page it should not resync.

fields.description:
- Fill up JIRA server data with a server that has high number of group memberships
- Click "Next" to start the sync.
- While the sync is happening, refresh the browser two times (leave a 5 second interval between refreshes)

*Expected*: Sync page to load and continue to sync. Next button to be disabled until the sync finishes, status message to change to state that synchronization has finished.

*Actual*: Sync page loads, status message no longer updates and the Next button is enabled (even though the sync is still occurring in the background). Confluence start with the admin user logged in but the screen states that it does not have permissions to access Confluence. This is due to the fact that the sync is not finished.

Notes:
- When the page is reloaded, there is an exception that is thrown in the log.
- After the sync finishes,  admin user is able to load Confluence normally.
- The same thing happens if browser is closed and reopened.
- Screen recording: http://screencast.com/t/Cedb0W7E5

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23006].
  {panel}

*Problem:*
With the small size of thumbnails, when there's only one single thumbnail image in the middle of text on a page, it's often hard to tell it's an image. And the visual presentation is somewhat strange. 

*What we do currently:*
Add the text 'click to enlarge' manually as part of an image title as shown in the screen capture.

*Improvements:*
* Thumbnails are displayed with a magnifier on top automatically. 
* One step further: Users can view the original image by hovering the mouse over thumbnails after a certain amount of time, say 0.5 or 1 sec, instead of having to click them.
fields.summary: Thumbnails should display "Click to enlarge" or a magnifier icon on top of images automatically

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22983].
  {panel}

When Confluence send an email from an user update its from field is sent this way:

"Name Surname (admin@confluence.com)"

This leads some users to reply to the email hoping it will reach the user but actually this will go to the email configured with Confluence mail server.

Confluence should send an email with the correct email from the user and not the admin email.
fields.summary: Mail server gives misleading information on From Name and From Address

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22981].
  {panel}

Confluence Dashboard doesn't get updated even after a re-index/re-index from scratch.

The following appears in the {{atlassian-confluence.log}}:
{code} 
Job (DEFAULT.IndexQueueFlusher threw an exception.
org.quartz.SchedulerException: Job threw an unhandled exception. [See nested exception: com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneException: com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneException: Couldn't open writer on directory: org.apache.lucene.store.SimpleFSDirectory@D:\confluence-home\index lockFactory=org.apache.lucene.store.SimpleFSLockFactory@1630667]
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:210)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.schedule.quartz.ConfluenceQuartzThreadPool$1.run(ConfluenceQuartzThreadPool.java:14)
	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:549)
Caused by: com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneException: com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneException: Couldn't open writer on directory: org.apache.lucene.store.SimpleFSDirectory@D:\confluence-home\index lockFactory=org.apache.lucene.store.SimpleFSLockFactory@1630667
	at com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneConnection.withBatchUpdate(LuceneConnection.java:409)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.DefaultConfluenceIndexManager.processTasks(DefaultConfluenceIndexManager.java:161)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.DefaultConfluenceIndexManager.flushQueue(DefaultConfluenceIndexManager.java:128)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor826.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:304)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:182)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:149)
	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:106)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
	at $Proxy39.flushQueue(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.IndexQueueFlusher.executeJob(IndexQueueFlusher.java:29)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.quartz.AbstractClusterAwareQuartzJobBean.surroundJobExecutionWithLogging(AbstractClusterAwareQuartzJobBean.java:63)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.quartz.AbstractClusterAwareQuartzJobBean.executeInternal(AbstractClusterAwareQuartzJobBean.java:46)
	at org.springframework.scheduling.quartz.QuartzJobBean.execute(QuartzJobBean.java:86)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:199)
	... 2 more
Caused by: com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneException: Couldn't open writer on directory: org.apache.lucene.store.SimpleFSDirectory@D:\confluence-home\index lockFactory=org.apache.lucene.store.SimpleFSLockFactory@1630667
	at com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneConnection.withWriter(LuceneConnection.java:346)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.tasks.LuceneConnectionBackedIndexTaskPerformer.perform(LuceneConnectionBackedIndexTaskPerformer.java:20)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.DefaultConfluenceIndexManager$BatchUpdateAction.perform(DefaultConfluenceIndexManager.java:361)
	at com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneConnection.withBatchUpdate(LuceneConnection.java:405)
	... 19 more
Caused by: org.apache.lucene.store.LockObtainFailedException: Lock obtain timed out: SimpleFSLock@D:\confluence-home\index\write.lock
	at org.apache.lucene.store.Lock.obtain(Lock.java:85)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.init(IndexWriter.java:1562)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.<init>(IndexWriter.java:1118)
	at com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneConnection.withWriter(LuceneConnection.java:327)
	... 22 more
{code}
Also, this may happened if you have an insufficient disk space. One of the contributors to this is scheduled daily backup, which can turn out to be large.

h5. Workaround
Delete {{write.lock}} from {{<confluence-home>/index/}}. If that only helps temporarily, check your Confluence home directory for any insufficient disk space. Please also refer to [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneException+Couldn%27t+open+writer+on+directory].

*Update for Confluence 5.3.1:*
The {{write.lock}} file is now removed from {{<confluence-home>/index/}} and {{<confluence-home>/index/edge/}} during a restart. Please, let us know if you are still experiencing this problem in 5.3.1 and newer versions.

fields.description:
If you follow the instructions from [this migrations guide|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Cluster+Installation+with+Existing+Data] to turn your non-clustered instance into a clustered instance, several attributes are not added into the {{confluence.cfg.xml}} that cause some erratic behavior.  The issue I encountered was in the Confluence Admin >> Cluster Configuration page, the nodes can see each other and you can see the proper node count, but the area under Active Nodes is blank.  Even if only one node is active, it should still display it's info in that area.

The attributes that are missing and will appear in the {{confluence.cfg.xml}} if you did a vanilla cluster install are:
{code:xml}
    <property name="confluence.cluster">false</property>
    <property name="confluence.cluster.address">225.xx.xx.xx</property>
    <property name="confluence.cluster.interface">en1</property>
    <property name="confluence.cluster.name">Bane</property>
    <property name="confluence.cluster.ttl">1</property>
{code}
fields.summary: Migrating to a cluster with existing data does not add cluster attributes to the confluence.cfg.xml

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22972].
  {panel}

The user currently embed some Youtube videos in some of his Confluence pages using the Widget Connector.

The Youtube allows a lot of parameters such as rel=0 and showinfo=0 for example but the wiget connector can only get one parameter for time. 

I reproduced the same steps that user did in my instance and occur the same error:

In Example 01: {widget:url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5nTAn6E_flE} - is the simplest case since it passes no parameters to YouTube.

In Example 02: {widget:url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5nTAn6E_flE&rel=0} - passes the rel=0 parameter to YouTube. This parameter tells YouTube to not include the "related videos" at the end of the video.

In Example 03: {widget:url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5nTAn6E_flE&showinfo=0} - passes the showinfo=0 parameter to YouTube. This parameter tells YouTube to not place the video title on the opening still image.

In Example 04: {widget:url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5nTAn6E_flE&showinfo=0&rel=0} - passes both the rel=0 and showinfo=0 parameters to YouTube. But, in this case, you can see (by fast-forwarding to the end of the video_ that the rel=0 parameter does not appear to have been passed to YouTube.

In Example 05: {widget:url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5nTAn6E_flE&rel=0&showinfo=0} - passes showinfo=0 and rel=0 (in reversed order) to YouTube. Again, in the case, the showinfo=0 parameter appears to be passed, but but the rel=0 parameter.

After this tests, it seems like Confluence is only passing one parameter to youtube (only the first).
fields.summary: Youtube widget doesn't support more than one parameter

fields.description:
- Most likely other versions of Confluence 3.5.x are affected as well, and maybe older versions
- Was working before in 3.1.1

Important to note is that this was working fine in at least Confluence 3.1.1. That is, we upgraded from 3.1.1 to 3.5.7 and all the WMV files were uploaded on the old version of Confluence, and after the upgrade, all WMV files are interpreted as an image MIME type.

The actual problem arises if you want to use any of the WMV's to display the video within the page with the multimedia macro, which fails with the error message:

'multimedia: Unable to display content of type: .WMV'

You can also see the wrong MIME type in the attachment page, see attached screenshot.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Upload any WMV-Video with the file extension in lowercase (e.g. video1.wmv). The file's MIME type will be correctly read as a video and thus can be used by multimedia macro.
2. Upload any WMV-Video with the file extension in uppercase (e.g. video2.WMV). The file's MIME type will be incorrectly interpreted an image mime type. Trying to use this file with the multimedia macro will result in an error message 'multimedia: Unable to display content of type: .WMV'
fields.summary: Confluence misinterprets attachment MIME type if file extension is uppercase

  {panel}

Creating a groups with a nested groups which is not included in the search filter would not mapped the user correctly.
This would result to unnecessary group management.

*How to reproduce*

Create a groups called "rootgroup". Member of this groups is two groups called

* "group1"
* "group2"

If the search filter of the group is {{(&(objectCategory=Group)(cn=rootgroup))}} the users of "group1" and "group2" will not be mapped to "rootgroup"

The ability to mapped the users of "group1" and "group2" would result to simplified group management which would helps a lot when you have a lot of groups.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22952].
  {panel}

Description: Current HTTP headers do not contain the X-FRAME-Option, which helps prevents against Clickjacking attacks. A Clickjacking attack is similar to CSRF in which attacker can hijack a "click" on a web application from another "invisible" frame in the browser. Essentially, an attacker can force a user to click on a button that is invisible to him/her.

Exploit Scenario: An attacker crafts a malicious page such that when their victim clicks, they are actually clicking on the link or button in the vulnerable application hosted in an iframe. Thus, an attacker tricks the user into performing an action of the attacker's choosing by directing mouse input to the target application.

Short Term Solution: There are 2 options in the HTTP response header for projection, include:

DENY: If the header contains the DENY option, then the response will not be loaded within a frame.
SAMEORIGIN: If the header contains the SAMEORIGIN option, the response will be loaded within a frame only if the parent page is from the same origin.

Examples below:

Apache:
Add this to your httpd.conf:
Header always append x-frame-options SAMEORIGIN

Note that this is not a panacea for clickjacking.

SAMEORIGIN should be safe to use. See also [JST-5291|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JST-5291?focusedCommentId=47107&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-47107]
fields.summary: Enable X-FRAME-Option in HTTP response headers in order to provide clickjacking protection

	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)

        

Referer URL

https://sv120/pages/viewpreviousversions.action?pageId=61505538
{code}

The cause is in LineLevelDiffer.java:344:
{code}
String[] origLines = origContent.split(LineLevelDiffer.NEWLINE);
{code}
According to the specification of String.split a single empty element is returned if the String origContent is empty but an empty array is returned if the string contains the new line character.

If both arrays are empty, the diff method will return null (line 33).

Steps to reproduce:
# create a new page, go to wiki markup editor and press enter in the editor. Save the page
# edit the page and enter some text, save the page
# edit the page again, delete anything in the wiki markup editor, press enter and save the page
# compare the first and last version of the page

Reproducible in sandbox too: http://sandbox.onconfluence.com/pages/diffpagesbyversion.action?pageId=3571755&selectedPageVersions=4&selectedPageVersions=2
fields.summary: Nullpointer Exception on PageDiff if both versions contains only a "\n"

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
Change the upload limit to 1MB in the Administration console
Attempt to upload a file that is over 1MB via Browse -> Attach on the Attachment page

*expected*
system advises user that the file exceeds the upload limit

*actual*
system hangs on the upload attachment page. As can be seen in the logs from the attached screenshot, no errors are being thrown
fields.summary: Attempts to upload attachments over the upload limit are not handled gracefully

fields.description:
In some support cases we discovered that the hibernate_unique_key table contains an incorrect {{next_hi}} value.

Confluence refer to this table to generate random number for its next content id, for example. Every time a new content is created/updated (ie. blogpost, pages, attachment, etc), this value will be changed higher.

This means if the is set to low, then Confluence will keep generating the same content id (when you are saving a page), which the database will refuse due to the constraint violation. Confluence does not realise that the operation was actually valid and not a duplicate entry.

In one case, we saw we had 2 rows in the *hibernate_unique_key* table. Deleting the row with a lower value of *next_hi* fixed the problem:
{code}
delete from hibernate_unique_key where next_hi = <some higher number>;
{code}
(!) there should only be 1 row in this table. We don't know how there are two rows in the hibernate_unique_key table. It's possible that it was created during XML import but it will be difficult to reproduce.

On another case, updating the value to some higher number (and Confluence restart) fixed the problem:
{code}
UPDATE
    hibernate_unique_key
SET
    next_hi = <some number higher than the previous next_hi>;
{code}

fields.description:
If your i18n strings contain the following entry--
{code}
gadget.message.foo=This is {0}''s message
{code}
--the map returned by {{ConfluenceI18nResolver.getAllTranslationsForPrefix("gadget", someLocale)}} will contain the incorrect string "This is {0}'s message", with a single apostrophe.

I think this may be due to this method calling {{i18nBean.getText(key)}} when it should be calling {{i18nBean.getTextStrict(key)}}. If so, the bug was introduced by changes for CONFDEV-3329 in Confluence 3.5.

The side effects in code that uses strings obtained by this method (which includes all JavaScript code in gadgets) can be serious: if the string is then passed to {{AJS.format}}, the unescaped single quote prevents subsequent placeholders from being substituted. Gadgets would have to double-escape their apostrophes ('''') to work correctly in Confluence, so any gadgets written for Conf 3.5 or 4.0 may have been using this workaround - which would result in extra apostrophes in other products.
fields.summary: ConfluenceI18nResolver.getAllTranslationsForPrefix incorrectly unescapes apostrophes

fields.description:
I downloaded the Bamboo documentation XML (zip) from http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ALLDOC/Applications+and+Tools+Documentation+Directory and imported/restored that into COnfluence. However, it failed but the space it created is corrupted and has many problems rendering. I am unable to delete the space and get this message when I pick the Space Admin option:
Error occurred during template rendering: Invocation of method 'getLogoForSpace' in class $Proxy44 threw exception java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Content must not be null at template/includes/macros.vm[line 1597, column 39]. Contact your administrator for assistance.
I would like to delete the space please but there doesn't seem to be any other way to do this other than via the, now inaccessible, space admin function.
fields.summary: Import Bamboo documentation XML creates corrupted space that can't be deleted

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22933].
  {panel}

The Firefox WebDAV plugin currently only automatically associates the {{.doc}} file format. This causes it to do nothing when a user clicks on "Edit in Office" or "Edit in Word" links that point to files with the following extensions:
* ppt
* pptx
* ppsx
* pot
* potx
* pptm
* docx
* dot
* dotx
* xls
* xlt
* xlsx
* xlst
* xlsm

It would be ideal if the programs that handled all these files were added automatically when installing the WebDAV plugin.

h3. Workaround

Manually add each extension and the path to the program that should handle it to the plugin by going to Tools > WebDAV Launcher Options.
fields.summary: Firefox WebDAV plugin does not automatically associate with most Office file types

fields.description:
After a few days of reguluar operation, the recently changed pages on the frontpage won't update. The Index Queue under Content Indexing shows that the last processed date is a long time in the past. After investigating the logfile catalina.out, the following exception seems to be the problem:

Exception in thread "Indexer: 1" org.springframework.transaction.UnexpectedRollbackException: Transaction rolled back because it has been marked as rollback-only
        at org.springframework.transaction.support.AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.commit(AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.java:626)
        at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate.execute(TransactionTemplate.java:139)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.search.lucene.DefaultObjectQueueWorker.run(DefaultObjectQueueWorker.java:51)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)

This exception is duplicated for multiple (all?) indexers.

After investigating the issue further, I found that a stale lockfile was in the Confluence working directory under index, called write.lock. After removing this file and restarting Confluence everything is working again.
fields.summary: Index not updating due to stale lock file

fields.description:
Trying to get CONF-10708 fixed (from 12/Feb/08). It states this was 'handled by support', but what this means is unclear. The error is still there.

Including an attached image fails if the image name has an underscore.  

!test_file.png!
!test_file.png|align=left!
!https://mysite.com/images/test_file.png!

...all fail

If I remove the underscore... works just fine.
fields.summary: image attachments fail to display if they contain an underscore

fields.description:
We use Confluence for our tecnical documentation. We often use large tables to give an overview over use cases for products etc. We know want to make those documents available for our customers. Therefore we paid a Atlassian Premium Partner to define an pdf layout according to our corporate design etc.

After finishing we noticed that while exporting to a pdf everything looks good but wide tables did not get scaled. The table simply gets cut off. That means that there is a loss of data during the rendering process making the pdf export basically completely useless! After complaining to our Atlassian Premium Partner they told us that this issue cant be resolved via pdf stylesheet or anything else and we should report this as bug.
fields.summary: PDF export for wide tables fails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22917].
  {panel}

Talking to Matt Ryall today, he had a dev docs improvement suggestion.

(Matt Ryall): ultimately, we need to have reference docs for those extension points, which should link out to a proper tute
(Matt Ryall): by "them", I mean "Extending the V2 search API" and "Searching using the V2 Search API"

These two pages require reference documentation and tutorials:

1. Searching using the V2 Search API
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Searching+using+the+V2+Search+API

2. Extending the V2 search API
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Extending+the+V2+search+API

These would be a useful addition to the developer documentation for Confluence.
fields.summary: Create Tutorials and Reference Documentation for "V2 Search API" Confluence Extension Points

fields.description:
As you can see on the attached screenshot we are using the german version of confluence. When we insert the {code}{jira-issues} or {jira} macro{code} anywhere in our Confluence the columns get not translated (assignee, reporter, summary). I already googled and searched your knowledge database but all the solutions I found where outdated or did not work. 

Can you please fix this bug or indicate a workaround. How can we get those columns translated properly? Where to set what?

Best regards,
Paul
fields.summary: Jira Issues Macro does not respect language settings

fields.description: There is currently no remote API provided to read and write user profile settings (stored in the os_propertyentry table). It would be useful for other applications to be able to read and manipulate user properties via the SOAP and XML-RPC APIs.

fields.description: A macro which returns OutputType.BLOCK and BodyType.NONE is rendered as inline in the editor, but then output as block in the view mode.

fields.description: As per CWD-1096, we should be able to ignore these exceptions and use the subset of results returned, if referrals are not enabled in the directory configuration.
fields.summary: Ignore PartialResultException if referrals are not configured

fields.description:
If you have a page which contains links for 2 pages a "PageTest" and "Test PageTest" and change the "PageTest" name to "Page Test", it will not only change the link for "PageTest", but will change the link for "Test PageTest" too, thus leading the link inaccessible.

* Create a page named "Test Page".
* Create two child pages of "Test Page," named "Using the TestEntryPage Page" and "TestEntryPage" and link to the children from "Test Page."
* Open "TestEntryPage" in a new tab, and edit its name to insert spaces.
* Refresh "Test Page".
* The "Using the TestEntryPage Page" link should be broken now, because spaces are inserted into the link,
fields.summary: Changing name of pages messes up the page shortname in CamelCase links

fields.description: Currently there is a lot of contention on the lock(handles) in the ObjectQueue. Reducing this contention should move reindexing from essentially being stuck on the lock to make it CPU bound.
fields.summary: Decrease re-indexing time

fields.description: It seems that there is no way to have rich text editing for inline macros that have a body. Ideally, it would be editable in the main window, but failing that, having some basic support in the body edit field in the Macro Browser/properties view would be a good start. Currently it can be entered in the property editor, but is done in raw 'storage format', which is less than ideal.
fields.summary: No rich text support for inline macros with a body

fields.description:
It would be useful if issues raised from a Confluence page using the "Insert Jira Issue" dialog automatically inserted a link to the origin Confluence page somewhere on the Jira ticket.

This would allow someone viewing the Jira ticket to see the context around which the Issue was raised
fields.summary: User wants a reference between Jira issues and the Confluence page from which they were raised

fields.description:
Procedure:
 - Create two pages named "PageNumberOne" and "SecondPage" in a space named "a." Each contains a link to the other.
 - Move SecondPage to space "b".
 - The link to SecondPage on PageNumberOne now reads (in markup) "[b:[b:SecondPage]]."
 - Move SecondPage to a space named "c."
 - Link on PageNumberOne now reads "[b:[c:[c:SecondPage]]]."
 - Move SecondPage to space named "d."
 - Link on PageNumberOne now reads "[b:[c:[d:[d:SecondPage]]]]."
fields.summary: CamelCase scrambles page names when moving them between spaces

HTML export for multiple spaces or entire wiki, with links between spaces

fields.description: Some mail servers don't allow sending of emails which have the "to" address send to a different value than the authenticated user (which was configured when setting up the mail server). The effect is that the email doesn't actually get sent and there will be error messages in the log files similar to "553 MAIL FROM:<user@example.com> does not match authenticated user name".
fields.summary: Share Page plugin set "from" address to the users email address instead of using "reply-to"

fields.description:
Attachment comment used to be retained after edit in word - this is the case when using Office Connector 1.5 _one point five_ in Confluence 3.0

Now it's no longer retained (tested in Confluence 3.5.5 and 3.5.7, OC 1.15 _one point fifteen_).

h5. Steps to replicate
# In a Confluence page, upload a word doc as an attachment. Include an attachment comment
# Edit in word and save
# In new version of the doc, the attachment comment disappears.
fields.summary: Attachment comment is not retained after Edit in Office
Should have an add status update button/field on the Status Updates tab

fields.description:
In version of Confluence previous to 3.5, when delegating user management to JIRA, users could change their password in Confluence as well as in JIRA. 

In Confluence 3.5, when using Connector 'Legacy Atlassian JIRA (4.2 and earlier)' the option "Read/Write" is no longer available on the User Directories section. See Screenshot 1 and screenshoot 3. 

In Confluence 3.5, when using Connector 'Atlassian JIRA' the option "Read/Write" is available on the User Directories section. See Screenshot 2.
fields.summary: Users cannot change password in Confluence  3.5 when using Connector 'Legacy Atlassian JIRA (4.2 and earlier)'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22887].
  {panel}

The UI for setting the e-mails is difficult to read and understand. The wording of the settings is too vague and both the "watches" and "all content" are in a single list making it confusing. See the attached screenshot from Confluence 3.5.7.

It would be good to have separate sections for subscriptions and notification settings. Maybe something like this:

{quote}
*Subscriptions*

* Receive a daily digest of all changes
* Receive notifications for changes made by people in your network
* Receive notifications for all new blog posts

*Automatic watching*

* Automatically watch content you edit or comment on

*Notifications*

Notification type: *HTML* | +Text+

* Include the changed content in the e-mail (HTML only)
* Include the entire content in the e-mail (HTML only)
{quote}
fields.summary: Improve UI for email notification settings and subscriptions
